item.title: Why I Play THE BINDING OF ISAAC
item.description: Isaac is a game of navigation, one that takes you room from room to confront new monstrosities. To date, I’ve clocked 439 hours on Edmund McMillen’s The Binding of Isaac: Afterbirth. This is the second of the Isaac games, which means that these 439 hours are on top of the 300ish hours I’ve spent on the first Binding of Issac. That’s an entire month of my life that I’ve spent on this game, and I’m not proud of it.
